intro: Lacis foeniculacea, commonly known as the golden ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Lacis foeniculacea is often found in grassland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
